snippet: Zions Bancorporation of Salt Lake City gained a foothold in the growing California market yesterday when it agreed to acquire GB Bancorp, a bank holding company based in San Diego, for $173 million in stock. Zions, with $7.2 billion in assets and ...
lead_paragraph: Zions Bancorporation of Salt Lake City gained a foothold in the growing California market yesterday when it agreed to acquire GB Bancorp, a bank holding company based in San Diego, for $173 million in stock. Zions, with $7.2 billion in assets and branches in Utah, Arizona, Nevada and Colorado, will gain $720 million in assets and 14 branches in San Diego County. Zions, which had owned 4.5 percent of the company since 1995, will issue about 4.7 million shares to acquire the remainder of the closely held GB, worth $173 million based on its closing price yesterday. Zions will take a $2 million charge in the fourth quarter for related expenses. Also yesterday, Zions completed its acquisition of Kelling, Northcross & Nobriga, an investment bank in Oakland, Calif., that specializes in raising capital for public agencies.
abstract: Zions Bancorporation of Salt Lake City gains foothold in growing California banking market when it agrees to acquire GB Bancorp, bank holding company in San Diego, for $173 million in stock; Zions completes its acquisition of Kelling, Northcross & Nobriga, investment bank in Oakland, Calif (S)

headline.main: ZIONS BANCORP TO ACQUIRE GB BANCORP FOR $173 MILLION
